title: Veterans Aging Cohort Study-Charlson Comorbidity Index (VACS-CCI)
description: Combines the Veterans Aging Cohort Study (VACS) Index with the Charlson Comorbidity Index to provide enhanced mortality risk prediction for patients with HIV. This integrated score incorporates HIV-specific biomarkers, general health indicators, and comprehensive comorbidity assessment to estimate 5-year all-cause mortality risk.

parameters.name: age
parameters.description: Patient age in years

parameters.name: sex
parameters.description: Patient sex for accurate eGFR calculation

parameters.name: race
parameters.description: Patient race for eGFR calculation (black race adjustment applied)

parameters.name: cd4_count
parameters.description: CD4 T-cell count in cells/μL, primary marker of HIV-related immunodeficiency

parameters.name: hiv_rna_log
parameters.description: HIV-1 RNA viral load in log10 copies/mL, measures viral replication and treatment effectiveness

parameters.name: hemoglobin
parameters.description: Hemoglobin level in g/dL, marker of anemia and overall health status

parameters.name: platelets
parameters.description: Platelet count in ×10³/μL, used in FIB-4 calculation for liver fibrosis assessment

parameters.name: ast
parameters.description: Aspartate aminotransferase in U/L, liver enzyme used in FIB-4 calculation

parameters.name: alt
parameters.description: Alanine aminotransferase in U/L, liver-specific enzyme used in FIB-4 calculation

parameters.name: creatinine
parameters.description: Serum creatinine in mg/dL, kidney function marker used for eGFR calculation

parameters.name: hepatitis_c
parameters.description: Hepatitis C virus co-infection status

parameters.name: myocardial_infarction

result.name: vacs_cci_score
result.description: VACS-CCI mortality risk score as percentage (0-100%)

ranges.interpretation: Low 5-year mortality risk. Routine HIV care and standard preventive measures appropriate. Regular monitoring and optimization of antiretroviral therapy recommended.
Moderate 5-year mortality risk. Enhanced monitoring and proactive management of comorbidities recommended. Consider intensified preventive interventions and specialist consultations.
High 5-year mortality risk. Intensive management required with multidisciplinary care approach. Aggressive treatment of all modifiable risk factors and frequent monitoring indicated.
Very high 5-year mortality risk. Maximum therapeutic interventions and comprehensive care coordination essential. Consider palliative care consultation and advance care planning discussions.

references: Justice AC, Lasky E, McGinnis KA, Skanderson M, Conigliaro J, Fultz SL, et al. Medical disease and alcohol use among veterans with human immunodeficiency infection: A comparison of disease measurement strategies. Med Care. 2006 Apr;44(4):S52-60. doi: 10.1097/01.mlr.0000208140.93199.44.

McGinnis KA, Fultz SL, Skanderson M, Conigliaro J, Bryant K, Justice AC. Hepatocellular carcinoma and non-Hodgkin's lymphoma: the roles of HIV, hepatitis C infection, and alcohol abuse. J Clin Oncol. 2006 Nov 20;24(33):5005-9. doi: 10.1200/JCO.2006.05.7984.

Tate JP, Justice AC, Hughes MD, Bonnet F, Reiss P, Mocroft A, et al. An internationally generalizable risk index for mortality after one year of antiretroviral therapy. AIDS. 2013 Feb 20;27(4):563-72. doi: 10.1097/QAD.0b013e32835c5b67.

Charlson ME, Pompei P, Ales KL, MacKenzie CR. A new method of classifying prognostic comorbidity in longitudinal studies: development and validation. J Chronic Dis. 1987;40(5):373-83. doi: 10.1016/0021-9681(87)90171-8.
formula: VACS-CCI = [(Linear Predictor + 2.5390222) / 10.6663937] × 100, where Linear Predictor combines VACS Index components (age, CD4, HIV RNA, hemoglobin, FIB-4, eGFR, HCV) with Charlson Comorbidity Index weighted scores
notes: Combines Veterans Aging Cohort Study Index with Charlson Comorbidity Index for enhanced mortality prediction
Incorporates both HIV-specific biomarkers and comprehensive comorbidity assessment
FIB-4 calculated as (Age × AST) / (Platelets × √ALT) for liver fibrosis assessment
eGFR calculated using CKD-EPI equation incorporating creatinine, age, sex, and race
Charlson comorbidities are weighted according to their impact on mortality risk
Score should be recalculated with updated laboratory values and clinical status
Developed and validated in HIV-infected veteran populations
Use in conjunction with clinical judgment for comprehensive patient assessment
